result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Prado Jr

defendant.name: Prado, Daniel, Jr
defendant.address: 8125 West Rogers Street, West Allis, WI 53219

records.addlTxt:
1:54 PM CASE RECALLED:
Defendant Daniel Prado Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Daniel Prado Jr. Attorney Julius Andriusis appears as a friend of the court. Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Andriusis informs the court that he has been retained for the defendant's lower pending matter only. For reasons stated on the record, Atty. Goodrich remains as attorney of record. Jury trial remains set for 11/7/22 at 8:30 AM.

Defendant Daniel Prado Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Daniel Prado Jr.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial held.  Rejected offer placed on record. Defense informs the court that the defendant has retained private counsel. Defense moves to withdraw as counsel. For reasons stated on the record, case passed until the afternoon.
State's Motion in Limine.  Received and Filed.  nk
State's Requested Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Daniel Prado Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. in court for Daniel Prado Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Bail/bond hearing held. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains calendared as previously set in Branch 36.
Scheduling Order.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Daniel Prado Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. in court for Daniel Prado Jr.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

SPANISH INTERPRETER SWORN: Daniel Lopez

Case in court for plea hearing. Defense requested bail hearing and trial date. Court granted defense's request. Case adjourned for bail hearing, final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 36; IN PERSON. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am. Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Prado Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Daniel Prado Jr.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Defendant has pending matters in Branch 29. Court authorize transfer for a possible global resolution. Defense requests a plea date. Court adjourn matter for a plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel Prado in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Daniel Prado in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Natalia Fajardo.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  However, State filed Original Information.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and offer.  Defense requests a status date to allow additional time for review with client.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel Prado in court with Attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant Daniel Prado in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 22CF2202. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer N. Beckett.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to the trial court.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29.
Defendant Daniel Prado not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for  a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Daniel Prado in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Daniel Prado in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel Prado appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  AS TO COUNT 2:  Motion to dismiss by the defense for lack of probable cause, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
